intro: Matelea petiolaris, commonly known as the Mexican candlewood, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant features showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Matelea petiolaris is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
